Based on modern concepts, plants synthesize in their most susceptible parts (flowers, roots, and leaves) special secondary metabolites for self‚Äêprotection against microorganisms, insects, and other pests, as well as to mitigate harmful environmental conditions.

144 In animals that use plants as their primary nutrition multiple mechanisms to counteract the potentially poisonous effects of phytotoxins have evolved. These natural compounds are not noxious in humans at lower doses but are able to induce mild cellular stress responses.
